page.title: 10PERIN'S COMMUNITY SCHOOL
page.content: The school is an 11 to 16 year comprehensive, serving a wide catchment area of about 70 sq. miles, with 860 pupils and 48 staff. The school was founded in 1698 by Henry Perin, a local doctor. Today the school offers courses in English, Mathematics, History, Geography, Art, German, French, Home Economics, Needlework, Commerce, Business Communications, Typing, Science, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Metal and Woodwork,Craft Design and Technology, Technical Drawing,R.E., Drama,Computer Studies and the new Technical and Vocational Course. The Community aspect is developing, there are adult classes in the evenings for a wide variety of academic and vocational subjects but it is envisaged that adults will be admitted to 'normal' daytime classes.
